alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 5:19AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Carroll and southwestern Fulton Counties through 545 AM EST... At 519 AM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Whitesburg, or 9 miles southeast of Carrollton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and increased chance of a brief tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...While winds should result in minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects, this storm has also exhibited localized rotation. A brief tornado could quickly form. Locations impacted include... City of South Fulton, Union City, Fairburn, Palmetto, Whitesburg, Chattahoochee Hills, Byers Crossroads and Campbellton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST for west central Georgia.
